intro: Arachnothryx gracilispica var. sooana, commonly known as the slender-spurred arachnothryx, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated flower spikes and small, delicate flowers that often have a distinctive spurred shape. It typically grows as an epiphyte or terrestrial shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
